commits.message: Disable the graceful_shutdown test only for py >= 3.11 on linux.
Security tests are now included in lint.
Attempt graceful shutdown once more. Only two attempts for Linux tests (they will timeout anyway by third).
Reduce tests for faster CI. Middle Python versions intentionally sparse.
Faster and less flaky keep-alive timeout test.

issue.title: Ruff formatter [v2]: remove flake8/black/isort and format to ruff defaults
issue.body:
This is a more radical fork of my other Ruff PR #2843 which already had a fairly large diff. This one strips away the old linters and doesn't attempt to follow their style anymore, so the diff keeps growing...

Both PRs are available for review and discussion. Have a look and state which one if either should be merged.

comment.body:
## [Codecov](https://app.codecov.io/gh/sanic-org/sanic/pull/2844?src=pr&el=h1&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=sanic-org) Report
Attention: `20 lines` in your changes are missing coverage. Please review.
> Comparison is base [(`a5a9658`)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/sanic-org/sanic/commit/a5a9658896984ddad484e168d4cb5c96e589fbad?el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=sanic-org) 88.387% compared to head [(`f50c413`)](https://app.codecov.io/gh/sanic-org/sanic/pull/2844?src=pr&el=desc&utm_medium=referral&utm_source=github&utm_content=comment&utm_campaign=pr+comments&utm_term=sanic-org) 88.484%.

> :exclamation: Current head f50c413 differs from pull request most recent head b4772b2. Consider uploading reports for the commit b4772b2 to get more accurate results

<details><summary>Additional details and impacted files</summary>


```diff
@@              Coverage Diff              @@
##              main     #2844       +/-   ##
=============================================
+ Coverage   88.387%   88.484%   +0.097%     
=============================================
  Files           92        92               
  Lines         7156      7147        -9     
  Branches      1228      1224        -4     
=============================================
- Hits          6325      6324        -1     
+ Misses         575       571        -4     
+ Partials       256       252        -4     
```

commits.message: Use future annotations also in touchup compile (Py 3.8 compat).
Try simpler Unions in expressions to suit Python 3.8.
Try simpler Unions in expressions to suit Python 3.8.
Try simpler Unions in expressions to suit Python 3.8.
Try simpler CancelledErrors type to suit Python 3.8.

issue.title: tests/test_http_alt_svc.py hangs for too long
issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Describe the bug

Running tests is slowed down by this one test that for some reason takes 20+ seconds but still appears successful once it finishes. Someone might have a look at why it does that.

### Code snippet

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### How do you run Sanic?

Sanic CLI

### Operating System

Linux

### Sanic Version

main

### Additional context

Tests on Github CI still mostly fail randomly / on timeouts, but this particular hang seems to happen reliably every time I locally run `tox -e py310`. Needs some care to restore useful CI and local testing functionality.

comment.body: Not really, I was cleaning up my old Pull Requests and noticed this had been open for some time with no activity. We've upgraded to a  newer version of Sanic which doesn't have this problem
